newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha weaker with crude, buyers scarce.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha weaker with crude, buyers scarce.

text.p: NWE naphtha physical and paper markets were slightly weaker in line with crude futures on Wednesday, with buying interest lethargic, traders said.
A 5,000-tonne parcel changed hands on the barge market at cif quotes high +25 cents fob ARA, the buyer a Belgian refiner looking to cover a prompt nomination.
NWE cargo prices were pegged as low as $225/$227 cif NWE by a major petrochemical buyer, but around $227/$229 by others.
Swaps shed around $2 a tonne to talk at $220.50/$221.50 for Nov with Dec at $214/$215.
